title: BT and Hubbub team up for smart home technology challenge
lead: The Smarter Living Challenge will initially work with 60 households across the UK, looking closely at attitudes, perceptions and behaviours around home energy use

title: Tech giants Apple and Amazon face backlash from MPs for ‘e-waste tsunami’ in the UK
lead: The Environmental Audit Committee says the companies are contributing to 155,000 tonnes of waste electricals ending up in bins every year

title: Almost a fifth of North Sea oil companies ‘expect to make further cuts in their workforce next year’
lead: Almost 22% of oil and gas businesses have reduced their staff by more than 10% during 2020, according to new research

title: Old fishing gear polluting the River Ganges is threatening wildlife, warn researchers
lead: A new study found levels of waste fishing gear are highest near to the mouth of the river in Bangladesh

title: Low Carbon seals agreement for the rights to the ‘UK’s largest’ community solar park
lead: The 19MW project will be made up of 45,000 solar panels and is forecast to generate enough electricity to power more than 6,000 homes

title: Shell UK reveals 18% average gender pay gap in 2020
lead: The average pay and bonuses for BAME employees was 8.5% lower than non-BAME staff in 2020, according to the company’s annual report

title: Government’s heat pumps plan ‘doomed to fail due to engineering skills shortage’
lead: More than 90% of the UK’s heating system engineers are not trained to properly install modern condensing gas boilers, according to a new report

title: Rishi Sunak unveils wealth of net zero funding in Spending Review
lead: The new spending plan laid out by the UK government prioritises the decarbonisation of transport, the net zero research and the revival of nature

title: Better Energy to develop solar park on restored wetlands
lead: It will be located in Køng Mose in Vordingborg Municipality, which is expected to supply around 42,000 households with green energy

title: Spain to allocate €54m for wind projects in Canary Islands
lead: The aid is expected to lead to the installation of at least 160MW of capacity in the Canaries
